scenes.title: Marzanna Hunt
scenes.speaker: Choose an option:
scenes.body: Something is watching. It wants to see what you choose.

scenes.title: Impact
scenes.speaker: SYSTEM
scenes.body: Asteroid shower incoming. Hull breach imminent. Navigation offline. In the dark, your partner finds your hand.

choices.text: Seal the cockpit bulkhead and attempt an emergency landing. Leave the rest to fate.
Transmit a final message and hold course.

scenes.title: Emergency Descent
scenes.speaker: NARRATOR
scenes.body: You seal the cockpit, but power surges through the frame and control starts to slip. The planet swells beneath you. You and your partner lock oxygen masks and brace as the world goes black.

scenes.title: System Collapse
scenes.speaker: NARRATOR
scenes.body: You divert power, but the grid overloads instantly. The ship drops into uncontrolled freefall. The hull tears open in three places. Your story ends in fire and vacuum.

scenes.title: Last Broadcast
scenes.speaker: PLAYER 1
scenes.body: "Mayday. Ship compromised. We are going down. Holding course." You squeeze their hand. Static answers. Then silence.

scenes.title: Wreckage
scenes.speaker: NARRATOR
scenes.body: Cold metal under your palms. Bitter wind cuts through the canyon. One oxygen canister blinks in the dark. The other seat is empty, harness torn open.

choices.text: Follow the distress beacon into the canyon.
Stay near the ship, conserve oxygen, and wait for rescue.

scenes.title: Signal Found
scenes.speaker: NARRATOR
scenes.body: The beacon pulses through the storm like a heartbeat. Not random. Deliberate. They are alive, and close enough to be found.

scenes.title: Containment Failure
scenes.speaker: NARRATOR
scenes.body: You wait too long in the wreckage. Oxygen runs thin, then gone. Your vision narrows to a tunnel, then to a point, then to nothing. Rescue comes to an empty suit.

scenes.title: Voyage
scenes.speaker: NARRATOR
scenes.body: A shadow peels itself off the canyon wall. It is too tall, too still, and too patient. It watches you like you are the final piece of a puzzle it already solved.

scenes.title: Voyage
scenes.speaker: NARRATOR
scenes.body: Your legs lock. Your body refuses every command, as if invisible hands are pinning you to the stone.

scenes.title: Voyage
scenes.speaker: MONSTER
scenes.body: Humans. Fragile and loud. Prove your soul has weight.

scenes.title: Morality
scenes.speaker: MONSTER
scenes.body: You did not run. Interesting. The other one did. Answer carefully. Your worth hangs in the balance.

scenes.title: Morality
scenes.speaker: MONSTER
scenes.body: Someone you love believes something dangerous and false. To pull them out, would you hurt them now to save them later, or let them stay happy and wrong?

choices.text: Break their heart, make them hate you, and force them to face a painful truth.
Let them stay happily wrong, because the truth would destroy them.

scenes.title: Morality
scenes.speaker: MONSTER
scenes.body: Interesting. Mercy and cowardice can look the same in the dark.

scenes.title: Morality
scenes.speaker: MONSTER
scenes.body: Your partner is closer to the beacon. If you sabotage them, your claim is secure, and they would never know. Is loyalty stronger than your need to win?

scenes.title: Morality
scenes.speaker: MONSTER
scenes.body: Noted. Ambition is honest, at least.

scenes.title: Morality
scenes.speaker: MONSTER
scenes.body: Your partner entered my domain before you. They said you would hesitate at the final moment, that your conscience makes you weak. Does that change your desire to find them?

scenes.title: Morality
scenes.speaker: MONSTER
scenes.body: How peculiar. You still choose them.

scenes.title: Morality
scenes.speaker: MONSTER
scenes.body: I can let you pass. But your partner will die. Will you accept that price?

choices.text: No. Even if they think I am weak, I refuse to let them die. Even if it costs my life, this is the choice I can live with.
Yes. I am tired of losing. Maybe this is what winning looks like.

scenes.title: Judgment
scenes.speaker: MONSTER
scenes.body: Heart over survival. Rare. You may pass. But understand this: ahead is not victory, only truth. Walk forward and carry it, or turn back and carry your guilt.

scenes.title: Sentence
scenes.speaker: MONSTER
scenes.body: You traded one soul for your own comfort. Unworthy. Judgment is immediate.

scenes.title: The Ruins
scenes.speaker: NARRATOR
scenes.body: Ancient ruins rise from the canyon floor. On jagged stone lies an oxygen mask. Fresh blood darkens the rock around it, still wet in the cold.

scenes.title: Final Choice
scenes.speaker: NARRATOR
scenes.body: No bodies. No answers. Just the mask, the blood, and your next decision. Some endings do not close. They follow you home.
